A '''copper golem statue''' is the result of a [[copper golem]] fully [[oxidizing]] and petrifying into a [[block]]. It can be {{Control|use|text=posed}} in four different ways, or it can be reanimated by {{Control|use|text=scraping it}} with an [[axe]] enough times.

== Obtaining ==
=== Breaking ===
Copper golem statues can be broken by hand, but using a [[pickaxe]] is the fastest. A copper golem statue retains its pose when broken.
[[File:Copper golem statue poses inventory.png|thumb|200px|All the copper golem statue poses in the [[inventory]]]]
{{breaking row
|horizontal=1
|link=none
|Copper Golem Statue
|Pickaxe}}

=== Post-generation ===
Once fully oxidized, a [[copper golem]] has a 0.58% chance per [[tick]] to become a copper golem statue and take a random pose, provided it is not [[waxed]] and is fully located in [[air]] (that is, a copper golem cannot turn into a statue while underwater or standing on a partial block such as a [[slab]], as part of its hitbox is not located within an air block). This process takes on average 8.62 seconds. During the transformation, any items held by the copper golem are [[drops|dropped]].

== Usage ==
=== Posing ===
{{control|Interacting}} with a copper golem statue changes its pose, cycling through four poses: standing, sitting, running, and star. {{IN|bedrock}}, the player's hand must be empty in order to cycle through poses.
<gallery>
Copper Golem Statue BE1.png|Default, standing pose
Copper Golem Statue (Sitting) BE1.png|Sitting pose
Copper Golem Statue (Running) BE1.png|Running pose
Copper Golem Statue (Star) BE1.png|Star pose
</gallery>

=== Oxidation ===
Unwaxed copper golem statues have four stages of oxidation, including the initial normal state. [[Lightning bolt]]s and [[axe]]s can remove the oxidation on copper golems statues. Using a [[honeycomb]] on a copper golem statue prevents it from oxidizing.

As the block begins to oxidize (exposed), it gets discolored and green spots begin to appear. As the oxidation continues (weathered), the block is a green color with brown spots. In the last stage (oxidized), the block is teal with several green spots.

=== Reanimation ===
Using an axe on an unoxidized unwaxed copper golem statue reanimates it into an unoxidized unwaxed [[copper golem]].

=== Piston interactivity ===
Copper golem statues break when pushed by [[piston]]s, cannot be pulled by them and they don't stick to [[slime block]]s or [[honey block]]s.

=== Redstone component ===
A [[redstone comparator]] can read the state of a copper golem statue and emit a signal strength based on its pose.

== Trivia ==
* "Waxed Weathered Copper Golem Statue" is the longest name of a block currently in {{JE}}, at 35 characters including spaces and 31 without, surpassing the previously tied record holders of [[polished blackstone pressure plate]] and [[cracked polished blackstone bricks]] by a single space.
** The longest block names {{in|be}} are "[[Hardened Light Blue Stained Glass Pane]]" and "[[Hardened Light Gray Stained Glass Pane]]", both having 38 characters including spaces and 33 without. However, these blocks are only available when enabling the "Minecraft Education features" cheat setting when outside of {{Edu}}.
** The all-time record {{in|JE}} is currently held by "[[Waxed Lightly Weathered Cut Copper Stairs]]", at 41 characters including spaces and 36 without, though the block has been renamed since.
*** There was a block in April Fools' snapshot [[Java Edition 24w14potato|24w14potato]] with a longer block name, "[[Quadruple Compressed Poisonous Potato Block]]", at 43 characters including spaces and 39 without.
** The longest name of any item {{in|JE}} is "[[Lingering Potion of the Turtle Master]]", sitting at 37 characters including spaces and 32 without.
